reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports by 10 November 2005 and 10 January 2006
summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:
- Recalls previous resolutions on the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC).
- Expresses concern over armed groups and militias in Eastern DRC.
- Condemns the illicit flow of weapons into DRC and vows to enforce the arms embargo.
- Recognizes the link between exploitation of natural resources and arms trafficking.
- Notes the situation in DRC remains a threat to international peace and security.

The Council:
1. Reaffirms demands from previous resolutions.
2. Renews provisions of paragraphs 20-22 of resolution 1493 until 31 July 2006.
3. Intends to modify or remove provisions if demands are satisfied.
4. Requests the Secretary-General to re-establish the Group of Experts within 30 days.
5. Requests the Group of Experts to continue its mandate, update the Committee, and report to the Council by 10 January 2006.
6. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
